text: Elephants are the only animals that can't jump, but they're excellent swimmers.
A rhinoceros horn is made of keratin, the same protein as human fingernails.
Giraffes sleep only 30 minutes a day in 5-minute increments.
The heart of a shrimp is located in its head.
A group of pugs is called a 'grumble.'
Houseflies hum in the key of F.
Sloths can hold their breath for 40 minutes underwater — longer than dolphins.
A cat's nose print is as unique as a human fingerprint.
Pigeons can do math at a level comparable to monkeys.
Tigers have striped skin, not just striped fur.
A starfish can regenerate its entire body from a single arm.
Penguins have knees — they're just hidden inside their bodies.
Hippos sweat a red oily substance that acts as sunscreen and antibiotic.
Kangaroos can't walk backwards due to their tail and leg structure.
The fingerprints of a koala are virtually indistinguishable from those of a human.
Dolphins shed their top layer of skin every 2 hours.
Crocodiles can go through 3,000 teeth in a lifetime.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance.'
Squirrels plant thousands of trees each year by forgetting where they buried nuts.
A cockroach can live for a week without its head before dying of dehydration.
The tongue of a blue whale can weigh as much as an elephant.
Pandas spend about 12 hours a day eating bamboo.
Mosquitoes are attracted to people who just ate bananas.
A chameleon's tongue is twice the length of its body.
Horses and cows sleep standing up, but dream lying down.
The eye of a giant squid is the size of a basketball.
Scorpions glow under ultraviolet light.
A dragonfly has a lifespan of 24 hours in its adult stage.
Octopuses have blue blood and three hearts.
A group of jellyfish is called a 'smack.'
Polar bears are left-handed — or more accurately, left-pawed.
A snail can have over 25,000 teeth.
Crows hold funerals for their dead and can recognize human faces for years.
An ostrich's eye is bigger than its brain.
Anteaters eat 35,000 ants per day but never destroy the ant colony to ensure future meals.
Axolotls can regenerate their brains, hearts, and limbs.
Spiders can't chew — they inject digestive enzymes and drink their prey.
A group of owls is called a 'parliament.'
Bats are the only mammals that can truly fly.
The monarch butterfly migration spans 4 generations — no single butterfly makes the full trip.
Wolves have about 200 million scent cells — humans have about 5 million.
Goats have rectangular pupils that give them 340-degree vision.
A group of ravens is called an 'unkindness.'
The platypus has no nipples — milk seeps through the skin for babies to lap up.
Woodpeckers' tongues wrap around their skulls to cushion their brains.
Dolphins have signature whistles — essentially names — for each individual.
Camels can drink up to 40 gallons of water in one go.
The mantis shrimp can punch with the force of a bullet.
Flamingos can only eat with their heads upside down.
A group of cats is called a 'clowder.'
